it.polimi.constraintcomputation.cleaner

Class AutomatonCleaner

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.constraintcomputation.cleaner.AutomatonCleaner

  • public class AutomatonCleaner
extends Object
    The intersection cleaner returns the states from which it is not possible to reach an accepting state from the intersection automaton.
    Indeed, the states from which it is not possible to reach an accepting state are not useful in the constraint computation.
    Author:
    Claudio Menghi

      creates a new Automaton Cleaner

    • Constructor Detail

      • AutomatonCleaner

        public AutomatonCleaner(BA automaton)
        creates a new Automaton Cleaner
        Parameters:
        automaton - contains the automaton from which the states that do not belong to an infinite accepting run must be computed
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the parameters is null

    • Method Detail

      • clean

        public Set<State> clean()
        Returns the states from which it is not possible to reach an accepting state from the intersection automaton.
        The procedure has a temporal complexity |S|+|T|, where |S| is the cardinality of the set of the states of the automaton and |T| is the cardinality of the set of transitions of the automaton
        Returns:
        The set of the states that have been removed from the automaton
